channel.title: [pi] added pkbox but its not in a wildy zone?
channel.description:
ok so i added a pkbox to my source and idk how to make it in wildy i know you have to go in player.java and set some coords under the inmulti boolean but idk likw what coords to put. i have a place and the picture for were i want my pkbox and i have the coords for the four corners can somebody tell me how the coords would look in player.java?
[IMG]http://i1038.photobucket.com/albums/a468/cjdean1/untitled-2-1.jpg[/img] [code]here are the coords of the 4 corners 1.x 2916 y 9713 2.x 2916 y 9699 3.x 2898 y 9699 4.x 2898 y 9713[/code]
also would the public void deletethatobject look like in objectmanager.java, i want to get rid of those tables:)

item.title: [pi] added pkbox but its not in a wildy zone?
item.dc:creator: @deans1243 deans1243
item.description:
@deans1243 wrote:

hmm ok ill look around in the client but like idk how to put the coords in ill just put them in the isinmulti boolean but how would they go

(absX >= xxxx && absX <= 2xxxx && absY >= yyyy && absY <= yyyy) ||

with the coords i have in the previous post how would i put them into that piece of code?

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] added pkbox but its not in a wildy zone?

@i0wn3v3ry wrote:

The tables may be Client side,
But for the Wild problem try and make a boolean “isinPKbox” and set coords like you would for the wild or something.
